heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 21 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 18 October 2025, is ranked 10th among the longest rainy periods since 23 September 2024.  It has lasted 6 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (198°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.4°C) and outside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 317 m), light levels (up 3016 lux), and pressure (up 12 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5127 lux) and cloud levels (up 594 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 317.3m lower than yesterday, 282.7m lower than the past week, 594.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 706m to 2390m and averaged 837.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry and less humid conditions and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (90%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
